disease: Squamous cell carcinoma of skin of other part of trunk

symptoms.name: Enlarging scaly or crusted lumps
symptoms.pattern: Usually arises within pre-existing actinic keratosis or intraepidermal carcinoma

physical_findings: May have central ulceration (mentioned in context of cutaneous SCC generally)
risk_factors: Numerous DNA mutations in multiple somatic genes
Mutations in the p53 tumor suppressor gene (caused by UV radiation)
Long-term cutaneous inflammation (chronic wounds, burns, scars, ulcers, or sinus tracts)
Pharmacological treatments with BRAF inhibitor monotherapy

required: Clinical features (enlarging scaly or crusted lumps)
Histological confirmation via biopsy or excision
